speaker: Niles
text: Mmm, that lemon sunrise smells refreshing.

speaker: Daphne
text: Ugh.  Tastes like a cup of cold sink.  Oh, it's hell to be pregnant.

speaker: Niles
text: I know.

speaker: Daphne
text: No you don't.

speaker: Niles
text: No I don't.  And that's why I got you this present.  [_He hands her an envelope and she opens it._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Belle de Jour Day Spa?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, it's for this afternoon.  I think you need a little pampering.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Niles.  I'm so lucky to have a husband who's so tolerant of my...

speaker: Niles
text: Mood swings?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_crossly_]  I would have come up with it, I'm not stupid!  [_Frasier comes in the front._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, all.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: What a glorious morning it is, isn't it?  [_to the counterman_] May I get my usual, please?  [_He sits down at the table._]

speaker: Niles
text: Well, well.  Nice to see you're approaching your first day of private practice with such an upbeat attitude.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I'm like an eager school boy on his first day of fractions.  So, how was the Van Laningdams' party last night? Weren't you lucky to snare an invitation?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes!

speaker: Daphne
text: No!

speaker: Niles
text: No.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_rising_]  Well, I'd better get over to your father's.

speaker: Niles
text: Call me later.

speaker: Daphne
text: I will.  Thanks again for my day of beauty.  [_She hugs him, then looks contrite._]

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry I snapped at you.

speaker: Niles
text: Did you snap at me?  I didn't even notice.

speaker: Daphne
text: That's because you don't listen!  [_She leaves and Niles sits back down._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, the mood swings.  Takes me back.  [_The waiter brings his coffee._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, anyway, in honor of your first day, I want to take you out to lunch.  There's a wonderful Indian restaurant right across the street from our building.

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, can we order in from them?  You see, I'm booked except between the hours of 11:45 and 12:30.

speaker: Niles
text: All right.  My, that's certainly an ambitious first day.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, I really want to pack in all I can.  That's why I took the day off from my radio show.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, happy sailing through the choppy waters of the dysfunctional and the disturbed.  [_They raise their coffee cups in salute.  Daphne rushes back in._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Optional eyebrow wax?  What is that supposed to mean?!  [_She rushes out again._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Same to you, Skipper.   [_Fade in.  Frasier is sitting in his chair.  A woman comes in, knocking on the open door._]

speaker: Peggy
text: Dr. Crane?  I'm Peggy.  I hope I'm not late.  [_N.B. Valerie Mahaffey worked with David Hyde Pierce on the short-lived NBC series, "The Powers that Be."_]  [_Frasier gets up to greet her._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Not at all, won't you come in?  I'm Dr. Frasier Crane, please, be seated.  [_She sits on the couch and Frasier retakes his seat._]

speaker: Frasier
text: First of all, welcome.  Whether our journey together lasts for years or just one day, I can't tell you how excited I am to take this first step with you.

speaker: Peggy
text: You know I'm just the temp?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, I see my first patient is here, if you could just see her in.  Thank you.

speaker: Peggy
text: [_rising_]  Righty-o.  [_She goes to the door and motions to the woman in the waiting area._]

speaker: Peggy
text: Go right in.  [_The patient comes in and Peggy goes out to her desk._]

speaker: Jane
text: Hello Dr. Crane, I'm Jane Walsh.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Jane.  Please, be seated, won't you?  I'm Dr. Frasier Crane.  [_They sit._]

speaker: Frasier
text: First of all, welcome.  Whether our journey together lasts for years or just for one day, I can't tell you how excited I am to take this first step with you.

speaker: Jane
text: Have we met?

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.  I am in the media.  So my face is recognizable.  But don't let that inhibit you.  [_He grabs a note pad._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, what's on your mind?

speaker: Jane
text: Okay, um...  Well sometimes I feel this, this kind of sadness hanging over me.

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.  And is this sadness triggered by anything...

speaker: Jane
text: Wait.  Did you used to date a woman named Stephanie Walsh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, a few years ago.

speaker: Jane
text: She's my sister.  Yeah, I met you at a party once.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  Well, then I'm glad that we cleared that up.  Now, this sadness of yours, is it a general...  [_He breaks off as Jane chuckles._]

speaker: Jane
text: I'm sorry.  I was just remembering something.  Uh, yeah, I'm sad all the time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, you are now at a place where you can feel free to express your...  [_He looks a bit perturbed as she snorts._]

speaker: Jane
text: I'm sorry.  I was just thinking about something my sister told me about you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, perhaps we should discuss it.

speaker: Jane
text: Okay.  Um, you were in bed with my sister and, uh, right in the middle of things I guess you called her "Milady"?

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.

speaker: Jane
text: I'm sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, please.  It's important that you feel free to express yourself to me.  Please, go on.

speaker: Jane
text: All right.  It became this, like, running joke between me and my sister.  She called me "Milady" and I called her "Milady" and my mother started doing it and now my aunt has a cat named "Milady".  [_Frasier forces himself to laugh along with her._]

speaker: Frasier
text: This isn't going to work, is it?

speaker: Jane
text: No, I don't think so.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay.  [_They get up._]

speaker: Jane
text: I am so sorry, again.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, please, not at all.  It's just fine.  [_He walks her to the door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: And best of luck conquering that constant sadness.  [_Cut to - the waiting room as she laughs and hurries off.  Frasier notices a man (Alex) sitting in one of the chairs._]

speaker: Peggy
text: If you're done, Dr. C, your next patient is here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Already?

speaker: Alex
text: Yeah, that's me.  [_He hurries in.  Cut to - the office as he sits on the couch._]

speaker: Alex
text: I find it's best to be no later than a half hour early.  Saves a lot of anxiety.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sitting down_]  First of all, welcome.  Whether our journey together lasts for years or just one day, I can't tell you how excited I am to take this first step with you.

speaker: Alex
text: No, this won't work.  [_He gets up and rushes to the door._]

speaker: Alex
text: Thanks.  Bye.  [_Cut to - the waiting room. As he leaves, he bumps into Niles.  Cut to - the office.  Niles steps in, Peggy is behind him._]

speaker: Peggy
text: Sir.  Sir!

speaker: Frasier
text: That's all right Peggy.

speaker: Niles
text: Goodness.  Done with your ten o'clock already?

speaker: Frasier
text: That was my eleven.  [_Niles checks his watch, then answers his cell phone when it rings._]

speaker: Niles
text: Hello?  Calm down!  Calm down!  What is it?  I was planning on lunching with Frasier.  No, if it's that urgent, I... I'll see you then.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_]  Oh, dear.  What's got Daphne all worked up now?

speaker: Niles
text: It wasn't Daphne.  It was Maris.

speaker: Frasier
text: Maris?!

speaker: Niles
text: I haven't spoken to her for months.  She says she needs to see me.

speaker: Frasier
text: About what?

speaker: Niles
text: I don't know.  She was hysterical.  I haven't heard her this panicked since her strength gave out halfway through a revolving door.  I have to cancel lunch.

speaker: Frasier
text: Can't you see her after lunch?  [_Niles goes to the door._]

speaker: Niles
text: I have patients.

speaker: Frasier
text: Before, then.  [_Cut to - the waiting room as Niles comes out._]

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, this just won't work out.  [_Peggy stands up and calls after him._]

speaker: Peggy
text: Well you could at least give him a chance.  It's his first day!  [_Frasier glares at her.  Fade out._]  **I'M LISTING**  [_Fade in.  Martin comes in with a plant._]

speaker: Martin
text: Excuse me, I'm crazy and I need to see the doctor.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Dad.  [_Martin sets the plant down._]

speaker: Martin
text: I brought you this for your office.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  Why don't you have a seat?  [_Martin sits on the couch as Frasier bends to the sides to look at his chair._]

speaker: Martin
text: What you doin' there?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm just trying to figure out this chair from Stockholm Design.  The instruction booklet alone would account for the high suicide rate.  [_Niles comes in._]

speaker: Niles
text: Hey.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hey Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, how did things go with Maris?

speaker: Martin
text: Maris?

speaker: Niles
text: She invited me to lunch at Le Toque.  [_He sits down beside Martin._]

speaker: Niles
text: She's gotten involved with some Argentine polo player.  Turns out he's a cad and a gold digger, with a violent temper to boot.

speaker: Martin
text: That's probably what she put in her ad.  [_Niles gives him a dark look._]

speaker: Frasier
text: So, Niles, what did you tell her?

speaker: Niles
text: I told her to leave him.  And if he causes trouble, get a restraining order.  She's very upset by the whole thing. Poor thing completely lost her appetite, barely touched her snail.  I'm supposed to be seeing Daphne, she's going to love this.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you're not going to tell her, are you?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I think I have to.  Don't I?

speaker: Martin
text: You don't tell your pregnant wife you had lunch with your ex.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I agree with Dad.  Normally, I'm a proponent of telling the truth, but as a man who's dealt with a pregnant spouse, I say lie, lie until your pants are on fire.

speaker: Niles
text: I see your point, of course, but this isn't just a little fib to cover up some after-work shoe shopping.  This is a big lie.  I'm, I'm just not comfortable with it.  [_Peggy steps in._]

speaker: Peggy
text: Dr. Crane?  I'm back from lunch.  Your next patient is here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Peggy.  Well, I'd love to stay here and chat, but duty calls.  [_They all get up and Martin and Niles head for the door.  As they reach it, Peggy whispers to them._]

speaker: Peggy
text: If you want to wait, he's usually very quick.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Peggy.  [_Martin and Niles leave.  The woman in the waiting room comes to the door._]

speaker: Carol
text: Hello, Dr. Crane.  I'm Carol Dryden.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Carol.  Please come in.  Won't you sit down?  [_She sits on the couch, Frasier closes the door and goes back to his chair._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Welcome.  Whether our journey lasts for several years or just for a day, I want you to know how excited I am to take this first step with you.  So, what's on your mind?  [_He grabs his pad as she starts talking._]

speaker: Carol
text: Uh, I guess I have trouble asserting myself?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh huh.  How so?

speaker: Carol
text: Well, like last week I was supposed to have dinner with some friends and...  [_She breaks off as Frasier's chair slips down on its support piston. He gives a little laugh, gets up and resets it._]

speaker: Frasier
text: There we are.  Please, why don't you go ahead?

speaker: Carol
text: Anyway, I really didn't feel up to dinner, but I'm the kind of person that hates to disappoint people, and I was the designated driver as usual...  [_As she speaks, Frasier's chair again slips down, this time with a ratcheting noise._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll tell you what, I'm just going to get another chair.  And why don't you keep talking, if you like  I can still hear you.  [_He pushes the chair back and goes to the door._]

speaker: Carol
text: So, we go to dinner and my two friends on either side of me are talking over me like I'm not even there.  [_Frasier has propped the door open and grabbed one of the chairs from the waiting room.  However, it's too large to fit through the door, so he shoves at it as Peggy watches._]

speaker: Carol
text: And then, when dinner arrived, my meal didn't come and no one even noticed.  [_Frasier stops pushing and climbs over the chair._]

speaker: Carol
text: I guess, after a while, that kind of thing gets to you?  It's like people aren't paying attention to me?  [_Frasier finally sits down in the chair, still stuck in the doorway._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I can see how that would be very frustrating for you.

speaker: Carol
text: And I'm a good person, but sometimes I just feel like the whole world is shutting me out.  [_Frasier tries to push the chair back out of the door.  He puts his foot up on the frame and shoves the chair over backwards and the door closes on Carol.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Niles is at a table with his cell phone.  Daphne walks in and he puts it down._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, there you are.  I was just calling to see if you were on your way.  [_He rises to hold her chair._]

speaker: Daphne
text: I used to move faster before I was carrying your child around in me.  [_She sits without kissing him._]

speaker: Niles
text: Why don't I get you a soothing cup of herb tea and then I'll tell you what an interesting lunch I had today.  [_He goes to the counter.  His cell phone rings and Daphne answers it._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello?  Yes, he just stepped away.  Who's calling?  What do you want, Maris?  [_Niles hears this and gets a look of panic on his face._]

speaker: Daphne
text: It most certainly is my business.  He's my husband now, you leave him alone.  [_She slaps the phone shut as Niles comes back with her tea._]

speaker: Daphne
text: That was Maris!  She has some nerve calling after all she put us through.  How stupid does she think you are that you'd have anything more to do with her?

speaker: Niles
text: Right.

speaker: Daphne
text: Cheer me up.  Tell me about your interesting lunch.  Who was it with?  [_Niles nervously sits down._]

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier.

speaker: Daphne
text: You have lunch with him all the time.  Wait a minute, I spoke to him earlier, he told me he was eating in.

speaker: Niles
text: And that's the interesting part.  Because just then Dad showed up and that clogged ear of his was acting up, so I took him to the doctor.

speaker: Daphne
text: That's not interesting.  And your father told me he was going to the dog track.

speaker: Niles
text: And that's where it gets interesting, because, after the doctor we had lunch at the dog track.  Let me just go check on your tea.  [_Martin comes in as Niles goes back to the counter._]

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Daph.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, Martin.  How are your ears?

speaker: Martin
text: Huh?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_louder_]  How are your ears?!

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, Dad, there you go.  [_He sets her tea down._]  I was just telling Daphne that I had lunch with you at the dog track.

speaker: Martin
text: Right.

speaker: Niles
text: After the ear doctor.

speaker: Martin
text: Right.  And how about that flat tire on the freeway?  Niles helped me change it.

speaker: Daphne
text: All right, now I know you're lying.  It all makes sense, now. First you get me out of the house with that spa, then this ridiculous story...  You're throwing me a surprise baby shower tonight, aren't you?

speaker: Martin
text: That's it!  Yeah.  But promise you'll look surprised when you come in through the door.  [_Daphne gets up and hugs Niles._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Niles, you are the sweetest man alive!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I should run.  The party's tonight and I have one or two finishing touches to attend to.  [_Daphne sits down as he turns away._]

speaker: Niles
text: Come along, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Huh?

speaker: Niles
text: Come along.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, uh, gee, well you know, my ear's really startin' to...

speaker: Niles
text: Get in the car!  [_Martin follows him out.  Fade out._]  _Act 2  Scene 1 - Niles' Apartment_  [_Fade in.  There is a gathering of people, including Roz and Kenny. Niles comes down the stairs with some brightly wrapped gifts._]

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Niles.  Not a bad party for two hours' notice.

speaker: Niles
text: It's a disaster!  [_He puts the gifts on the side table._]

speaker: Niles
text: None of Daphne's friends could make it.  I told the caterer I wanted a maternity motif, he thought I said "fraternity" and now we have three kegs of beer and a six foot hoagie.  [_Kenny comes over._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Great spread, Niles.  [_Niles looks confused._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Kenny Daley, Frasier's boss.  Roz invited me.  Sorry I didn't bring a present.

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, you did.  A baby blanket.  You'll find it in the pile on the table.

speaker: Kenny
text: Great.  Oh, by the way, your wife's a peach.

speaker: Niles
text: My wife isn't here yet.

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, no.  Whose stomach did I just rub?  [_Over at another table, Martin and Frasier are eating.  Roz comes over._]

speaker: Roz
text: Wow, Frasier, you're really stuffing your pie-hole.

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, I've had a very tough day.  I'm entitled to a little comfort food before my evening appointment.  [_His stomach growls loudly._]

speaker: Roz
text: That was pretty.

speaker: Martin
text: Let me give you a tip, son.  Tough nights on the force, I used to eat like that.  Trouble was, I'd be sittin' in the squad car all night, pants diggin' in, stomach makin' unholy noises.  There's only one thing that helps:  loosen your belt and pop the top button.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Dad, for schooling me in the ancient ways.  [_There is a sound of the door being unlocked, Daphne's mom jumps up from the couch._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, here she comes.  [_Everyone gets ready as Daphne comes in._]

speaker: Everyone
text: Surprise!

speaker: Daphne
text: My God, what a surprise.  I've never been so surprised!  Oh, thank you, Niles.  [_They hug._]

speaker: Daphne
text: All these people who mean so much to us.  Mom and Frasier and [_gesturing to Kenny_] you...  And our doorman.  [_She closes the door and speaks aside to Niles._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Doesn't he work with Frasier, that man at the big sandwich?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, once word got out, who was I to say "No"?

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't see many of my friends yet.  Will Holly be coming? Margaret or Tina?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I had to make the cut off somewhere.  Excuse me darling.  [_He rushes to the kitchen, grabbing and dragging Martin along.  Cut to - the kitchen as they burst in.  Niles begins gasping in a panic attack.  Martin hands him a pastry sack to breath into._]

speaker: Martin
text: Calm down, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: I can't!  I'm telling her another lie every time I open my mouth!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, get a grip on yourself, man!  It's called "marriage"!  [_Niles continues hyperventilating into the bag.  Cut to - the living room as Frasier opens the door to reveal a young man._]

speaker: Esteban
text: Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Esteban
text: I'm Esteban de Rojo.  I'm the lover of your ex-wife Maris.

speaker: Frasier
text: You've made a mistake.

speaker: Esteban
text: No, you have.  [_He punches Frasier in the eye, sending him staggering as everyone gasps._]

speaker: Daphne
text: What did you do that for?

speaker: Esteban
text: This ex-husband had lunch with my Maris today.  He gave her fool's advice and she was a fool to follow it!  [_He turns and storms out._]

speaker: Roz
text: Are you all right?  [_Roz hurries to Frasier, then rushes past to follow Esteban.  Niles and Martin come in from the kitchen, Daphne goes over to her husband._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles, did you have lunch with Maris today?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I was just about to tell...

speaker: Daphne
text: So you weren't planning my shower at all?  This whole party was just a sham?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm so sorry.

speaker: Daphne
text: Not as sorry as I am.  [_She turns away and grabs her purse._]

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, Daphne, wait.  There's...

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't want to hear it.  I've never been so humiliated in my life.  [_She stalks across the room._]

speaker: Doorman
text: Allow me.  [_He opens the door and she stomps out.  He closes it behind her while Frasier tries to look around through his rapidly blackening eye.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Frasier is sitting, nursing his eye.  Peggy comes in._]

speaker: Peggy
text: Dr. Crane, your appointment is here.  Is your eye okay?  It's kind of twitching.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, just a little unfortunate accident.  Please, send her in.  [_Peggy ushers a young woman in and closes the door on her way out. Frasier rises to shake her hand._]

speaker: Shannon
text: Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello.

speaker: Shannon
text: I'm Shannon Palmer.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Shannon.  Please, won't you be seated.  I'm Dr. Frasier Crane.  [_She sits on the couch and Frasier retakes his seat._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, first of all, welcome.  Whether our journey together lasts for years or only just a day, I can't tell you how excited I am to take this first step with you.  [_Frasier's eye has twitched on the word "excited", looking like a sly wink._]

speaker: Shannon
text: Okay.  Um, geez, this is a little hard to talk about...  [_Frasier grabs his pad and pen._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, just relax.  You know, many of my patients find it easier to open up if they're lying down.  [_He twitches/winks again._]

speaker: Shannon
text: Um, okay.  [_She lays down on the couch._]

speaker: Shannon
text: Well, I guess I have problems with men.  No matter what they say, all they really seem to want is sex.  [_Frasier's stomach growls, Shannon looks nervously at him._]

speaker: Shannon
text: It's hard, because I want to be loved for who I am, of course, but if who I am is an attractive woman...  [_Frasier's stomach growls again._]

speaker: Shannon
text: What was that?

speaker: Frasier
text: It must be the air conditioning or something.  [_twitch/wink_] Please continue.  [_She looks dubious but goes on.  Frasier turns in his chair to adjust his belt._]

speaker: Shannon
text: It's at the point now, I meet a perfectly nice man and I don't trust him.  [_The phone rings._]

speaker: Frasier
text: The machine will get it.  [_There is a click as the answering machine kicks in and a woman's voice comes from the speaker._]

speaker: Stephanie
text: This is Stephanie Walsh.  Remember, "Milady"?  Sorry about my sister.  You're not the first guy to do something weird in bed...  [_Frasier jumps up and grabs the phone, ripping it loose and dropping it to the floor.  As he pulls back, his pants fall down and Shannon gasps._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm so sorry.  [_He notices his pants._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good lord!  [_He bends a bit, then stumbles and falls on top of Shannon who lets out a small scream._]

speaker: Shannon
text: What the hell?!  [_She pulls away and gets up.  Frasier clumsily gets to his feet and pulls up his pants._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry!  I'm sorry!

speaker: Shannon
text: What is wrong with you?!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's not my fault!  It's just a trick I learned from my dad!  [_Shannon, disgusted, pulls the door open and makes her escape.  Peggy comes in as Frasier finishes with his pants._]

speaker: Peggy
text: You certainly know how to keep 'em movin'!  Anyways, if you could sign my time card, I'll be going.  Although, if you haven't hired anyone permanent, yet...

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Peggy, I'm afraid I won't really be needing anyone permanent.  [_He takes her card and sits down to sign it._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm starting to think this return to private practice was a big mistake.

speaker: Peggy
text: Everyone's first day is a little rough.  Well, except mine, I didn't even have to do any billing.  [_She laughs as he rises and hands her card back._]

speaker: Peggy
text: Nice meeting you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nice meeting you, too.  [_They shake hands.  She winks back at his twitching eye, then leaves, a flattered smile on her face.  Frasier collapses onto his couch.  A man knocks on the door and steps in._]

speaker: Brad
text: Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Brad
text: Uh, I was your three o'clock that cancelled.  I got cold feet.  I was hoping maybe you could squeeze me in.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_]  Oh, well uh, I was just about to put this day out of its misery, but please come in.  [_He closes the door behind him and shakes Frasier's hand._]

speaker: Brad
text: Thanks.  I'm Brad Kincaid.  That's not my real name.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll just get it off your insurance form.  Why don't you have a seat, Brad.  [_They sit._]

speaker: Frasier
text: First of all, welcome.  Whether this journey...well, forget it.  Uh, what's troubling you?

speaker: Brad
text: Well, I just went through a messy divorce, and my kid's in another city.  I came here to begin a new career, but it's not happening for me and I'm thinking maybe I made a big mistake.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Brad, sometimes things take a little longer to turn in our favor than we think they should.

speaker: Brad
text: How long?

speaker: Frasier
text: That depends.  Tell me more, I'm listening.

speaker: Brad
text: Okay.  Well, I've been here about six months now, and...  [_Frasier settles in as he continues to talk.  Fade out._]  **DON'T CRY FOR ME ARGENTINA**  [_Fade in.  Niles is straightening up and listening to the radio. Daphne comes in._]

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, I am so sorry.  [_She hugs him._]

speaker: Daphne
text: It's all right.  Well, not completely, but I'm not as mad as I was.  I just don't understand why you couldn't tell me you were having lunch with Maris.  [_They sit on the couch._]

speaker: Niles
text: I was going to, but you were just so upset when she called. I didn't know how you'd react.

speaker: Daphne
text: I suppose I have been a little bit difficult lately, haven't I?  [_Niles sits frozen for a moment._]

speaker: Niles
text: There's just no good answer to that.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm too tired to talk about this right now.  All I want is a nice cup of tea and a warm bed.  [_They get up and head to the kitchen._]

speaker: Niles
text: Coming up.  One last word: I tell you Maris will never come between us again.  [_As they go into the kitchen, the music on the radio ends and the announcer comes on._]
